intro: Geranium neglectum, commonly known as the common geranium, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It typically grows to a height of 10–30 centimeters, featuring upright stems and opposite, heart-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, five-petaled flowers in shades of pink, red, or white, which bloom from late spring to early autumn. Geranium neglectum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for garden borders and rock gardens. Its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements contribute to its widespread cultivation.
